I‚Äôve long wondered whether a schism is coming in the Catholic Church.

There‚Äôs been a long-simmering progressive movement (esp. in the US) putting pressure on Rome from the left. And increasingly, pressure from the extremely conservative faction, exemplified by Strickland, esp. in light of Pope Francis‚Äô ‚Äúlove all, include all‚Äù hippie leanings. I wonder if he‚Äôll have the strength and longevity to hold it all together.

https://www.wsj.com/us-news/pope-francis-fires-conservative-u-s-bishop-a32d7caa

items.content_html:
Today is election day. üá∫üá∏

On the ballot in Ohio is a citizen-initiated law that would legalize marijuana. If it passes, Ohioans will be allowed (beginning on 7 December) to grow up to six cannabis plants at home (or 12 if two or more adults live in the house).

It might be time to take up gardening.

items.content_html:
My idea to end the debate over Daylight Saving Time versus Standard Time forever

is to create Universal Variable Time, defined around four fixed times of day, EVERY DAY, as follows:

üåÖ 06:00 - Sunrise
üèûÔ∏è 12:00 - ‚ÄúMidday,‚Äù the time exactly between sunrise and sunset
üåá 18:00 - Sunset
üåÉ 00:00 - ‚ÄúMidnight,‚Äù the time exactly between sunset and sunrise

Let the scheduling begin.

#DST #DitchDST #EndDaylightSaving #DaylightSavingTime #StandardTimeForever #StandardTime

Tonight the sun will set at 17:25 and The Reign of Darkness begins.

I hate winter time. For me, the issue isn‚Äôt so much the time CHANGE as it is the getting dark just as I‚Äôm finishing my work day, which makes it feel like I‚Äôm living in perpetual night. Very depressing. I‚Äôd much rather stay on DST year-round, but that‚Äôs not an option under current federal law. ü§î

Sears is still in business?

Nvidia is making it work

For all the hype around corporations being ‚Äúinnovative‚Äù it‚Äôs telling that so many CEOs are unwilling to actually innovate the workplace. Instead they continue to press workers to return to the office, which hasn‚Äôt actually changed much since the first ‚Äúopen office‚Äù spaces were introduced 100 years ago, and where many spend most of the day ‚Äúcollaborating‚Äù via videoconference. Wake up, it‚Äôs 2023.

Nvidia, a $1 trillion AI powerhouse, is fine with remote work‚Äîand is ignoring the return-to-office trend
